div.l: Lo where he goþ ye lat þe children pleyn
They gete hym nouȝt so lightly my crown
These sely clerkes remen vp an down
Wit kepe · kepe · stand · stand · iossa warderere
Ga whistil þou · and I sall kepe hym here
But shortly til that it was v̉errey nyght
They kouþe nouȝt þouȝ þei dide al hir myght
Hir͗e caple cacche he ran al wey so faste
Till in a diche þey caught hym at laste
Wery ⁊and wete as best ys in þe rayn
Comyth sely Iohn and wiþ him comyþ Alayn
Allas qduod Iohn þe day þas I was born
Now ar we dryuen til hething ⁊and til scorn
Oure corn is stole men wole vs foles calle
Boþe þe wardeyn and oure felawes alle
And namely þe meller weylawey
Thus playneþ Iohn as he goth by þe wey
Toward þe Melle and bayard in his hond
The Meller sittyng bi þe fir he fond
For it was nyght ⁊and ferþer myght he nouȝt
But for loue of god þei him be souȝt
Of herberewe ⁊and of ese as for hir peny
The Meller seide a geyne if þ̉er be eny
Swich as it is shal ye haue youre part
My hous is streyte but ye han lerned art
Ȝe can bi argument make a place
A Mile brood of twenty fote of space
Lat se now if þis place mow suffice
Or make it rowm̉er with speche as is your gise
Now Symoıı̄und seid þis Iohn be seynt Cutberd
Ay is þu mery þat is faire answerd
I haue herd say men sal taken of twa þynges
